main.name: Will Homan
main.occupation: Web developer actively seeking full-time opportunities.
main.description: I design and program websites and web applications of all types.
main.bio: I am recently graduated from the Coding Dojo in Bellevue and am actively seeking new developer opportunities in the greater Seattle area. I have 9 years previous experience in IT support. I have a passion for all things tech and when not coding you'll find me enjoying life with my wife and two young daughters.

education.description: Completed an intensive web development program with more than 1000 hours spent learning and building 50+ single and multi-page web apps using Python, JavaScript, and C#.

work.title: IT Support Engineer
work.description: Configured and managed AD, Exchange, backups, network, AV, IT documentation, and all other aspects of IT infrastructure for clients. Left to persue programming career.

work.title: Executive Support Technician
work.description: Provided comprehensive technical support to Microsoft corporate vice presidents, executive vice presidents, the Board of Directors and their admins as a member of the Executive Support Team.

work.title: Techlink Lead Technician
work.description: Managed team of eight people at walk-in IT support site (Techlink) on Microsoft main campus serving 400-1000 customers weekly. Was responsible for initial training of new Techlink hires. Provided tier 2 troubleshooting and technical support as member of Deskside Senior Support Group.

work.title: Techlink Technician
work.description: Provided IT support for Microsoft employees and vendors as a walk-up service in a retail-like environment where customer service was the highest priority.

work.title: IT support Specialist
work.description: Provided desk side technical support to all Microsoft and vendor end users in coverage area.

work.title: Transportation Management Coordinator
work.description: Transportation NCO assigned to the 949th Movement Control Team. Deployed to Iraq January 2005 to December 2005.

testimonials.text: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
It is never too late to be what you might have been.

What is the recipe for successful achievement? To my mind there are just four essential ingredients: Choose a career you love, give it the best there is in you, seize your opportunities, and be a member of the team.
